About.Name: Shewit Yonas
About.AboutText:
Hi, I’m Shewit Yonas, a Mechanical Engineering student at Seattle Pacific University with a strong passion for engineering design, problem-solving, and hands-on technical work. I am particularly interested in CAD design, mechanical systems, and engineering analysis, and I enjoy applying engineering principles to real-world challenges.

With experience working as an engineering intern, an academic tutor, and a student project designer, I have developed a strong foundation in communication, teamwork, and technical design. I thrive in collaborative project environments where I can contribute practical solutions, learn advanced tools, and grow both technically and professionally.

Outside of academics, I enjoy working on multidisciplinary engineering projects, from prototyping mechanical systems to developing performance models in MATLAB. I am committed to continuous learning, expanding my skillset, and pursuing opportunities that integrate mechanical design, sustainability, and innovation.

Experience.ExperienceText: I have built experience across engineering design, CAD modeling, environmental work, and academic support roles. I enjoy combining technical ability with communication and project leadership, and I am actively developing my engineering skillset through internships and hands-on projects.
Experience.EducationText: My engineering education includes rigorous coursework across design, thermodynamics, mechanics, heat transfer, systems modeling, and technical communication. I maintain a 3.95 GPA and am a recipient of the Full Tuition Distinguished Scholar Award.

EmploymentHistory.Description: Produced 50+ 2D and 3D CAD drawings from land survey data using AutoCAD. Drafted and QC-checked 20 parcel maps for Sound Transit Light Rail expansion. Researched legal documents and wrote 20+ legal descriptions for easements and land acquisitions.

Tutored ELL students in reading, writing, and conversational English. Coordinated schedules for multiple tutors per shift. Created targeted writing improvement plans using analysis of student work across academic subjects.

Planned and proposed a summer program to educate teens about environmental initiatives and green careers. Participated in environmental restoration projects including kelp transplantation and invasive ivy removal. Led meetings and conducted career development interviews.

Leadership.Details: Lead weekly professional development meetings for 20 members covering résumé workshops, industry Q&A sessions, and interview preparation. Represent NSBE on the STEM Student Council Board, coordinate cross-club collaborations, and help plan engineering outreach and campus events.

Project1.Title: SoulUmbra — Semi-Autonomous Solar Energy Robot
Project1.Desc: Co-developing a solar energy collection robot featuring a retractable solar panel array and an actuator-driven lifting system. Responsible for CAD modeling, mechanism development, motor selection, and early motion control planning.

Project2.Title: Prosthetic Hand Prototype
Project2.Desc: Designed and 3D-printed a functional prosthetic hand prototype including a palm housing, motor mounts, and a full linkage system for natural finger curling and thumb rotation. Assembled and integrated with the electrical control system.

Project3.Title: Water-Cooled Air Conditioner Prototype & MATLAB Performance Model
Project3.Desc: Built and tested a water-cooled AC prototype using a fan, copper tubing, pump, and ice bath. Developed a MATLAB model to calculate heat transfer rate, convection coefficients, and system efficiency.
